TopicTitle: Poll: When are you going to buy KSP2

Articles.Content:
So as we close in on the release date for EA, I have been debating whether to start playing on EA day one. After all the anticipation day one is my first instinct, but I also don't want to burn myself by the time it hits 1.0.

I am also waiting for them to release system requirements, since my once mighty laptop is now kind of a withered potato in need of an upgrade, which will happen soonTM, but waiting for the right deal and specs.

So, I thought we might all be interested in the overall sentiment around these parts
As much as I've been a little unsure about the way things have been going, I'm probably going to hop right on the train as soon as it comes out to be a part of it from the get-go. I'm excited

26 minutes ago, GigFiz said:

I don't want to deal with lots of bugs and performance issues;

Precisely why I'm using KSP 2 instead of the former
I have things to do that I've wanted to do for a while. I can just wait two weeks from now and do them properly.
I'd love to jump in day 1 but I have to consider priorities. I may have to wait a few weeks.

On 2/9/2023 at 4:00 PM, Bej Kerman said:

Precisely why I'm using KSP 2 instead of the former 

Ba-dum tsss

 

They'll be here all night ladies and gentlemen.

 

But you ain't wrong either

Edited February 11, 2023 by GigFiz
There's a he?

22 minutes ago, GigFiz said:

He'll be here all night ladies and gentlemen.

There's a he?
I can't play it until the 28th

In NZ it won't be released until the 25th apparently... and I'm going to be busy that day and away from my computer for another week.

So we'll see what happens.

I also need to know what specs are required as my trusty 8 year old might not cope anymore.

I will be picking this up day one as soon as I can.  Depends on work that day how much I play.  I fully expect to log my first support ticket - which will invariably be the billionth logged that day - about an hour later.

My plan is to wait until 1.0, or at least until the beta is stable.  However I imagine everyone that knows me fairly well is assuming that's a lie and I'll be buying it on day zero.

 

 

 

They're probably right.
I'm probably gonna wait for a couple reviews first, if they have early early access for critics then I will look at those and see what they say.

I'm certainly going to buy it the hour it releases, but I still don't know for sure that my old-ish laptop will run it.  Min specs and graphics tweakability are still big factors for me.  I'll be more than happy to play it at low settings and upgrade later.

Buying day one (as soon as I get home from class anyway, can't skip any unfortunately), so I'll have some time to see how the Steam reviews stack up. While I would hate to see it, I'm expecting mixed reviews (about 70% positive) due to unforeseen bugs and whatnot. We'll have to see though.

2 hours ago, GigFiz said:

After all the anticipation day one is my first instinct, but I also don't want to burn myself by the time it hits 1.0.

This a very valid point, but hopefully the several big content updates will keep gameplay new and interesting until 1.0.  Then who knows where development will go.  I hope that after the science update save files will transfer through the updates, so that I can play progressively through them.
Buying on day one but i have to wait until my ship arrived at first port which will be 2 weeks after that sh... satellite network

I have no interest in a sandbox mode with missing features, so definitely not day 1.  On the other hand, I also have no interest in multiplayer, so I'll probably get it after the important features are finished but before 1.0.  I just hope I can keep up with reviews and feedback while avoiding spoilers for things I'd rather discover for myself.
Not 100% sure when I'm going to get it. It depends on many factors, not the least of which is do I think I'll enjoy playing it?

Definitely on the 24th, although knowing life it will unlock in the late afternoon CET time and will be downloading for a bit. Then again kids will probably fall asleep just before the download finishes.
Day One...  But may end up being day two if the store/website is too busy.

When I finish my current KSP play-through.  Started January 2018 (v1.3) and now (v1.11.2) projecting to get the basics of system colonization done by mid-2028.

Or when everyone else gives the all-clear signal: whichever comes later...

"Space is not only hard, but time-consuming"

I adore KSP and of course super excited for KSP2. 
 I will however hold off buying it day one as the price is unacceptable for an early access game. I will wait to see how the part performance is and if the devs actually include the features it should have had at launch. I know I will be waiting more than a year to play it but it gives me time to save for a new PC. ☺️
Gonna have to put Fallout 4 in the backburner for a little while!
As soon as I can. TAKE MY MONEY!!!

So you get the idea, I'll be pressing F5 on the Store page the second the clock ticks release time
